alert.note: Alert for Barbour; McDowell; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Raleigh; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Raleigh; Upshur; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 16 at 2:40AM EST until January 16 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Virginia and northeast, northern, southeast and southern West Virginia. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 AM EST this morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 5 PM this afternoon to 11 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Additional information can be found at https://www.weather.gov/rlx as well as on our Facebook and Twitter pages.
